Take a look back at 2018,and learn about the work ahead in 2019!

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

2018 was quite the year! Citizens engaged with local and national leaders as never before, and the results of citizen engagement were incredible: From getting Trump to that Trump back down on his cruel family separation policy at the national level to beating back abortion restrictions in South Carolina, citizens spoke and leaders listened.

Join us for our Annual General Membership Meeting on Saturday, January 26 in beautiful Beaufort, SC. Let's reflect on 2018 and talk about what's in store for this coming year with the ACLU and the ACLU of South Carolina!

2019 Annual General Membership Meeting

Join us as we reflect on the accomplishments of 2018 and look ahead to work in 2019!

Saturday, January 26, 10 a.m. - 12 p.m.
Unitarian Universalist Fellowship of Beaufort
187 Sam's Point Road
Beaufort, SC 29907

RSVP TODAY

In November 2018, ACLU supporters voted like their rights depended on it, and a slew of candidates won their elections with campaign promises to uphold civil rights and civil liberties in the new Congress.

2018 was a busy year, and it is with renewed confidence that 2019 will be even better. We'll use our collective voices to continue to hold elected officials accountable.

Will you join us?

We'll see you in Beaufort!

ACLU of South Carolina
